page.title: 12Churches in Ferryhill
page.content: In the 14th Century there was a small church in Ferryhill dedicated to St.Ebbe and St.Nicholas.This church disappeared during the Civil War.After this the people of Ferryhill attended church at Kirk Merrington over a mile away.A new church was built in 1829 but Ferryhill was still part of the parish of Kirk Merrington until 1853. There are now 12 places of worship in the Ferryhill area {Churches}Ferryhil 2:Broom 2(one is a very small church beside a cemetary and is only used for funerals):Ferry- hill Station 1. {Chapels}Ferryhill 3:Broom 1:Ferryhill Station 1. {Others}Jehovah's Witness and Salvation Army. There are no places of worship in either Stobbs Cross or Mainsforth.
